result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon J Traverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling as directed by probation agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No contact with the victims.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Take medications as prescribed. Follow all treatment provider recommendations in 15-ME-46. Write apology letter to officers involved.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to 15-CM-111. Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served.
To pay the costs of the action. (costs have been paid in full)
Concurrent to Ct. 2. Huber release and good time granted.
To pay the costs of the action. (costs have been paid in full)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon J Traverson

defendant.name: Traverson, Jonathon J
defendant.address: 920 Alabama Pl Apt 12, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Emails between Jail Dep. Jim Werner and ADA Korb regarding sentence credit.

Defendant Jonathon J Traverson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Jonathon J Traverson in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathon J Traverson in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 2 & 3.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 2 & 3. Court dismisses Ct. 1 butr reads in for sentencing.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant reads apology letter to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Jonathon J Traverson in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Malcore feels matter will resolve short of trial, requests a plea/sentencing date. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Jonathon J Traverson in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Malcore asks that status be set in this file the same day as pretrial in 15-CF-133. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Jonathon J Traverson in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 8/09/15 by jail staff.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Take medications prescribed and follow all doctors orders.

Defendant Jonathon J Traverson appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
